Hi Rob,

On 8/2/06, Robert Martin <UncleBob@...> wrote:
>
>
> =
The argument about "TIME" is laughable.  It is like saying that we
> don't =
have time to test, but we DO have time to debug.


You seem to imply that t=
here are only two kinds of code:

   - Code that is tested and works
   - C=
ode that is not tested and doesn't work

There is actually something in the=
 middle:  it's called "Code that is not
tested but that works".

It's a fai=
rly common occurrence, in my experience, and the reason behind my
comments =
earlier:  if other circumstances warrant it, it's okay to write the
code, s=
hip it and write the tests later.

Just use your judgment, that's why your =
employer is paying you.
